message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about text mining and machine learning, specifically about improving the representation of text documents. The paper discusses the limitations of the Bag of Words (BoW) and TF-IDF representations, which are commonly used in information retrieval and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also discusses the issue of overfitting, which is a common problem in machine learning, so cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. The paper proposes an unsupervised algorithm to learn improved sBoW document features, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions the use of the proposed algorithm for document classification, which is a common task in information retrieval, so cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of the proposed algorithm for text classification tasks such as sentiment analysis and topic modeling, which are common tasks in computer vision, so cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also a possible sub-category.
